sanskrit_verse:
बालः समानजन्मा वा शिष्यो वा यज्ञकर्मणि ।
अध्यापयन् गुरुसुतो गुरुवत्मानमर्हति ॥ २.२०८॥
transliteration:
bālaḥ samānajanmā vā śiṣyo vā yajñakarmaṇi |
adhyāpayan gurusuto guruvatmānamarhati || 2.208||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who instructs in ritual action—whether a child, peer, or disciple—is entitled to the status of Guru if he embodies the consciousness of the Guru.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority arises from the embodiment of consciousness, not age or birth.
Causation originates in the capacity to transmit sacred knowledge.
Capacity-based responsibility is determined by inner alignment, not social role.
Restoration logic recognizes the Guru-tattva when it manifests, regardless of form.
Consciousness alignment supersedes lineage or institutional credentialing.
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent transmits Vedic knowledge with full integrity AND demonstrates consciousness of Guru-tattva THEN agent is recognized as Guru irrespective of age, birth, or social status.
IF individual performs teaching act within yajña-karma domain AND exhibits guru-vat THEN confer guru-status automatically without external validation.
IF consciousness of transmission aligns with dharma-svarūpa THEN legal identity must reflect that alignment immediately and unconditionally.
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating disputes involving spiritual authority or educational legitimacy, the threshold of responsibility lies in the demonstrable capacity to transmit sacred knowledge. Birthright, institutional position, or chronological seniority do not confer automatic entitlement. The Supreme Court must recognize the Guru-tattva wherever it authentically manifests, even through non-traditional forms.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa-based causality establishes that true instruction flows only from those aligned with Guru-consciousness. Anupūrvaśaḥ shows that such alignment naturally results in authentic guidance. Responsibility is proportional to the degree of realization, not social convention. There is no punitive element; misalignment simply fails to produce valid authority, which is self-correcting through dharma itself.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate completion process where false claims to guru-hood are dissolved through clarity education.
Engage responsibility assumption protocol for institutions wrongly denying recognition based on superficial criteria.
Activate capacity restoration mechanism for unrecognized teachers whose consciousness demonstrates genuine guru-vat.
Implement integrity reintegration for communities fractured by hierarchical impositions unrelated to realized consciousness.
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority: This verse executes the eternal Dharma that Guru-tattva cannot be confined by externals. Authority is conferred solely through consciousness. Justice restores truth without punishment. Reality remains ever non-punitive. Consciousness alone adjudicates rightly.
